algorithm_technique: Greedy strategy: use the smallest unique positive even integers first.
problem_summary_simple: Split a number into the maximum count of unique positive even integers.
problem_summary_technical: Greedily picks smallest unique even numbers (2, 4, 6, ...) until the remaining sum is less than the next even number, then adds it to the last picked number.
key_insights: To maximize the number of integers, we should use the smallest possible unique positive even integers (2, 4, 6, ...).
The remaining sum after picking as many small even numbers as possible is added to the last picked number to ensure uniqueness and sum correctness.
